segments.text: I notice the boy stretching for those cookies, and it’s making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around to see what they’re doing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy has ever fallen like this before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster in the making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how ridiculous this all is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her task, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t hurt himself, but he’s really asking for it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm outside and the chaos inside is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR
